item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Sigmund Freud
item.description: "Religious doctrines … are all illusions, they do not admit of proof, and no one can be compelled to consider them as true or to believe in them." -- Sigmund Freud

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Sigmund Freud
item.description: "Religion is an illusion and it derives its strength from the fact that it falls in with our instinctual desires." -- Sigmund Freud

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Sigmund Freud
item.description: "We are never so defenseless against suffering as when we love." -- Sigmund Freud

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "The one thing you can’t take away from me is the way I choose to respond to what you do to me. The last of one’s freedoms is to choose one’s attitude in any given circumstance." -- Viktor E. Frankl

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Viktor E. Frankl
item.description: "Everything can be taken from a man but one thing: the last of the human freedoms—to choose one’s attitude in any given set of circumstances, to choose one’s own way." -- Viktor E. Frankl

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "In a word, I was too cowardly to do what I knew to be right, as I had been too cowardly to avoid doing what I knew to be wrong." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Heaven knows we need never be ashamed of our tears, for they are rain upon the blinding dust of earth, overlying our hard hearts. I was better after I had cried, than before--more sorry, more aware of my own ingratitude, more gentle." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "Every traveler has a home of his own, and he learns to appreciate it the more from his wandering." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "I took her hand in mine, and we went out of the ruined place; and, as the morning mists had risen long ago when I first left the forge, so, the evening mists were rising now, and in all the broad expanse of tranquil light they showed to me, I saw no shadow of another parting from her." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "We were equals afterwards, as we had been before; but, afterwards at quiet times when I sat looking at Joe and thinking about him, I had a new sensation of feeling conscious that I was looking up to Joe in my heart." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "There have been occasions in my later life (I suppose as in most lives) when I have felt for a time as if a thick curtain had fallen on all its interest and romance, to shut me out from anything save dull endurance any more. Never has that curtain dropped so heavy and blank, as when my way in life lay stretched out straight before me through the newly-entered road of apprenticeship to Joe." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "Abandon hope." -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "This is how the entire course of a life can be changed: by doing nothing." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "There did not have to be a moral. She need only show separate minds, as alive as her own, struggling with the idea that other minds were equally alive. It wasn't only wickedness and scheming that made people unhappy, it was confusion and misunderstanding, above all, it was the failure to grasp the simple truth that other people are as real as you. And only in a story could you enter these different minds and show how they had an equal value. That was the only moral a story need have." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "However, withered, I still feel myself to be exactly the same person I've always been. Hard to explain that to the young. we may look truly reptilian, but we're not a separate tribe." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Ian McEwan
item.description: "It wasn't torpor that kept her - she was often restless to the point of irritability. She simply liked to feel that she was prevented from leaving, that she was needed." -- Ian McEwan

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "We cannot change the cards we are dealt, just how we play the hand." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "Experience is what you get when you didn't get what you wanted. And experience is often the most valuable thing you have to offer." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "The brick walls are there for a reason. The brick walls are not there to keep us out. The brick walls are there to give us a chance to show how badly we want something. Because the brick walls are there to stop the people who don’t want it badly enough. They’re there to stop the other people." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "Wait long enough and people will surprise and impress. When you're pissed off at someone and you're angry at them, you just haven't given them enough time. Just give them a little more time and they almost always will impress you." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "Believe nothing a man tells you and everything he shows you"....(Taken from a farewell video from a dying father to his infant daughter on dating)" -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "My colleague told me: "It took a long time, but I finally figured it out. When it comes to men who are romantically interested in you, it's really simple. Just ignore everything they say and only pay attention to what they do." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "The key question to keep asking is, Are you spending your time on the right things? Because time is all you have. " -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "You may not want to hear it, but your critics are often the ones telling you they still love you and care about you, and want to make you better. " -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "There are more ways than one to measure profits and losses." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "Showing gratitude is one of the simplest yet most powerful things humans can do for each other." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Randy Pausch
item.description: "One thing that makes it possible to be an optimist is if you have a contingency plan for when all hell breaks loose." -- Randy Pausch

item.title: Kelly Jones add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Eat a live frog first thing in the morning and nothing worse will happen to you the rest of the day." -- Mark Twain
